recipe.title: Quinoa Stuffed Bell Peppers
recipe.ingredient list:
4 large bell peppers (any color)
1 cup quinoa, rinsed
2 cups vegetable broth
1 can (15 oz) black beans, drained and rinsed
1 cup corn kernels
1 diced tomato
1/2 cup diced red onion
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 tsp cumin
1 tsp chili powder
1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese (optional)
Salt and pepper to taste
2 tbsp olive oil
recipe.instructions:
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cut tops off peppers and remove seeds. Place in a baking dish.
In a medium saucepan, combine quinoa and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes or until quinoa is tender.
In a large bowl, mix cooked quinoa, black beans, corn, tomato, onion, garlic, cumin, and chili powder. Season with salt and pepper.
Stuff the peppers with the quinoa mixture. Drizzle with olive oil.
Cover the baking dish with foil and bake for 30-35 minutes.
If using cheese, remove foil, sprinkle cheese on top, and bake uncovered for an additional 5 minutes or until cheese melts.
recipe.allergen information: Contains dairy if using cheese. Can be made dairy-free by omitting cheese.
recipe.storage information: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Reheat in microwave or oven.
recipe.tips:
For a vegan version, omit cheese or use vegan cheese alternative.
Add diced zucchini or carrots for extra vegetables.
Serve with a side of Greek yogurt or sour cream for added protein.

recipe.title: Lemon Herb Grilled Chicken with Roasted Vegetables
recipe.ingredient list:
4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts (about 6 oz each)
2 tbsp olive oil
2 tbsp fresh lemon juice
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 tsp dried oregano
1 tsp dried thyme
Salt and pepper to taste
2 zucchinis, sliced
2 bell peppers, sliced
1 red onion, cut into wedges
1 tbsp balsamic vinegar
recipe.instructions:
In a small bowl, mix olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Place chicken in a shallow dish and pour half the marinade over it. If time allows, marinate for 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C) and prepare a grill or grill pan.
In a large bowl, toss vegetables with remaining marinade and balsamic vinegar.
Spread vegetables on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, stirring halfway through.
While vegetables are roasting, grill chicken for 6-8 minutes per side, or until internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
Serve grilled chicken with roasted vegetables.
recipe.storage information: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Reheat in microwave or oven.
recipe.tips:
For extra flavor, add lemon zest to the marinade.
You can use any combination of vegetables you prefer.
Serve with a side of quinoa or rice for a more substantial meal.

recipe.title: Creamy Coconut Lentil Curry
recipe.ingredient list:
2 cups dry red lentils, rinsed
1 can (14 oz) coconut milk
2 cups vegetable broth
1 onion, diced
3 cloves garlic, minced
1 tbsp grated fresh ginger
2 tbsp curry powder
1 tsp turmeric
1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes
2 cups chopped spinach
1 tbsp coconut oil
Salt to taste
Fresh cilantro for garnish (optional)
recipe.instructions:
In a large pot, heat coconut oil over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, and ginger. Sauté for 5 minutes until onion is translucent.
Add curry powder and turmeric. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add lentils, coconut milk, vegetable broth, and diced tomatoes. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
When lentils are tender, stir in chopped spinach and cook for an additional 3-5 minutes until spinach is wilted.
Season with salt to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro if desired.
recipe.allergen information: Contains coconut. No other common allergens.
recipe.storage information: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. Reheat on stovetop or in microwave.
recipe.tips:
Serve over brown rice or with naan bread (ensure vegan if needed) for a complete meal.
Add diced carrots or sweet potatoes for extra vegetables and nutrition.
For a spicier curry, add a diced jalapeño or red chili flakes to taste.

recipe.title: Grilled Salmon with Avocado Salsa
recipe.ingredient list:
4 salmon fillets (6 oz each)
2 tbsp olive oil
1 tsp garlic powder
1 tsp paprika
Salt and pepper to taste

For the avocado salsa:
2 ripe avocados, diced
1 small red onion, finely chopped
1 tomato, diced
1 jalapeño, seeded and minced
Juice of 1 lime
1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
Salt to taste
recipe.instructions:
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
In a small bowl, mix olive oil, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Brush the salmon fillets with the seasoning mixture.
Grill salmon for 4-5 minutes per side, or until it flakes easily with a fork.
While salmon is grilling, prepare the avocado salsa: In a medium bowl, gently mix avocados, red onion, tomato, jalapeño, lime juice, and cilantro. Season with salt.
Serve grilled salmon topped with avocado salsa.
recipe.allergen information: Contains fish (salmon). No other common allergens.
recipe.storage information: Best served immediately. If needed, store salmon and salsa separately in airtight containers in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.
recipe.tips:
For a different flavor profile, try using lemon juice instead of lime in the salsa.
Serve with a side of grilled asparagus or zucchini for a complete paleo meal.
If you don't have a grill, you can bake the salmon in the oven at 400°F (200°C) for about 12-15 minutes.

recipe.title: Greek-Style Turkey Meatballs with Tzatziki
recipe.ingredient list:
1 lb lean ground turkey
1/4 cup almond flour
1 egg
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 tsp dried oregano
1/2 tsp dried mint
1/4 cup finely chopped red onion
1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
Salt and pepper to taste

For the tzatziki:
1 cup Greek yogurt
1/2 cucumber, grated and squeezed dry
1 clove garlic, minced
1 tbsp lemon juice
1 tbsp fresh dill, chopped
Salt to taste
recipe.instructions:
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, mix all meatball ingredients until well combined.
Form mixture into 20 meatballs and place on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 15-18 minutes, or until meatballs are cooked through (internal temperature of 165°F/74°C).
While meatballs are cooking, prepare tzatziki: Mix all tzatziki ingredients in a bowl.
Serve meatballs hot with tzatziki sauce for dipping.
recipe.allergen information: Contains egg, dairy (feta and yogurt), and nuts (almond flour).
recipe.storage information: Store meatballs and tzatziki separately in airtight containers in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Reheat meatballs in microwave or oven.
recipe.tips:
Serve over a bed of mixed greens or with roasted vegetables for a complete meal.
For a lower-fat option, use ground turkey breast instead of regular ground turkey.
These meatballs can also be pan-fried in a non-stick skillet for about 3-4 minutes per side.

recipe.title: Zucchini Noodle Shrimp Scampi
recipe.ingredient list:
4 medium zucchini
1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
4 cloves garlic, minced
1/4 cup olive oil
2 tbsp butter
1/4 cup fresh lemon juice
1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
1/4 tsp red pepper flakes
Salt and black pepper to taste
recipe.instructions:
Spiralize zucchini into noodles using a spiralizer or vegetable peeler.
Heat olive oil and butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add garlic and red pepper flakes, sauté for 1 minute.
Add shrimp, cook for 2-3 minutes per side until pink.
Add zucchini noodles, lemon juice, and parsley. Toss and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately.
recipe.allergen information: Contains shellfish (shrimp). May contain traces of dairy (butter).
recipe.storage information: Best served fresh. If storing, keep refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 2 days. Reheat gently to avoid overcooking the shrimp.
recipe.tips:
Don't overcook the zucchini noodles to prevent them from becoming mushy.
For a dairy-free version, replace butter with additional olive oil.
Pat shrimp dry before cooking for better browning.
Add grated Parmesan cheese for extra flavor if your carb allowance permits.
For meal prep, spiralize zucchini ahead of time and store in the refrigerator.

recipe.title: Vegan Buddha Bowl (Plant-based, Gluten-free)
recipe.ingredient list:
1 cup quinoa
1 can chickpeas, drained and rinsed
1 sweet potato, cubed
1 cup kale, chopped
1 avocado, sliced
1/4 cup hummus
2 tbsp tahini
1 lemon, juiced
1 tsp cumin
Salt and pepper to taste
recipe.instructions:
Cook quinoa according to package instructions.
Roast sweet potato and chickpeas with cumin at 400°F for 20 minutes.
Steam kale for 2-3 minutes.
Assemble bowl with quinoa, roasted vegetables, kale, and avocado.
Top with hummus and drizzle with tahini-lemon dressing.
recipe.storage information: Refrigerate components separately for up to 3 days.
recipe.tips:
Swap quinoa for brown rice if preferred.
Add tofu for extra protein.

recipe.title: Mediterranean Delight Grilled Chicken
recipe.ingredient list:
4 chicken breasts
1/4 cup olive oil
2 lemons, juiced
3 cloves garlic, minced
1 tsp dried oregano
1/2 cup Greek yogurt
1 cucumber, diced
2 tomatoes, diced
1/4 cup feta cheese
Salt and pepper to taste
recipe.instructions:
Marinate chicken in olive oil, half the lemon juice, garlic, and oregano for 30 minutes.
Grill chicken for 6-7 minutes per side.
Mix yogurt with remaining lemon juice for tzatziki sauce.
Serve chicken with tzatziki, diced vegetables, and feta.
recipe.tips:
Serve with whole grain pita bread for a complete meal.
Use herbs like mint or dill in the tzatziki for extra flavor.

recipe.title: Protein Powerhouse Lentil Loaf
recipe.ingredient list:
2 cups cooked lentils
1 cup rolled oats
1/2 cup chopped walnuts
1 onion, diced
2 carrots, grated
2 eggs (or flax eggs for vegan version)
2 tbsp tomato paste
1 tsp dried thyme
1 tsp garlic powder
Salt and pepper to taste
recipe.instructions:
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Mix all ingredients in a large bowl.
Press mixture into a loaf pan.
Bake for 40-45 minutes until firm.
recipe.allergen information: Contains nuts, eggs (unless using flax eggs)
recipe.storage information: Refrigerate for up to 5 days or freeze for up to 3 months.
recipe.tips:
Serve with a side salad or roasted vegetables.
For a vegan version, use flax eggs (1 tbsp ground flaxseed mixed with 3 tbsp water per egg).

recipe.title: Caveman's Delight Beef Stir-Fry
recipe.ingredient list:
1 lb flank steak, sliced thin
4 cups broccoli florets
1/4 cup coconut aminos
2 tbsp sesame oil
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 tbsp ginger, grated
1 tbsp arrowroot powder
Salt and pepper to taste
recipe.instructions:
Mix coconut aminos, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, and arrowroot powder.
Stir-fry beef in a large wok or skillet until browned.
Remove beef, stir-fry broccoli until tender-crisp.
Return beef to pan, add sauce, cook until thickened.
recipe.tips:
Serve over cauliflower rice for a low-carb option.
Add other Paleo-friendly vegetables like bell peppers or mushrooms.
